holidays.name: International Chocolate Day
holidays.description: A delightful day dedicated to indulging in the world's most beloved sweet treat: chocolate! Perfect excuse to eat as much chocolate as you like without guilt.
holidays.origin: Though no single origin story exists, this day celebrates the widespread love for chocolate and its global cultural significance.
holidays.funFact: Chocolate was once used as currency by the ancient Aztecs!

holidays.name: Positive Thinking Day
holidays.description: A quirky holiday encouraging everyone to think positively, spread good vibes, and look on the bright side of life.
holidays.origin: Founded by Christian D. Larson, a New Thought leader, to promote optimism and the power of positive thinking.
holidays.funFact: Studies show that positive thinking can actually improve your physical health!

holidays.name: Defy Superstition Day
holidays.description: A fun, rebellious day challenging common superstitions‚Äîwalk under ladders, open umbrellas indoors, break mirrors, and laugh in the face of bad luck!
holidays.origin: Started by skeptics and lovers of superstition lore as a way to poke fun at irrational fears.
holidays.funFact: The fear of the number 13 is so strong, there's a term for it: triskaidekaphobia.

holidays.name: Hugging Day
holidays.description: An unofficial but warm-hearted day dedicated to sharing hugs with friends, family, or even strangers to boost happiness and reduce stress.
holidays.origin: Emerging from various 'hug therapy' and mental health awareness movements promoting the power of physical touch.
holidays.funFact: A single hug can release oxytocin, known as the 'love hormone,' that helps reduce stress and create bonds.
